text:
Symptoms of infertility:

In women:

- Pain during sex.
- Heavy, long, or painful periods.
- Irregular menstrual cycle.
- Hormone changes.
- Body pain.
- Obesity.

In men:

- Hormonal imbalances.
- Erectile dysfunction.
- Ejaculation problems.
- Changes in testicles.
- Obesity. pic.twitter.com/MRfOPZoJu3

text:
Bleeding while using hormonal birth control (HBC) typically happens during “no hormone” days (when taking placebo pills, or the times in between new rings).

The bleeding experienced while using HBC is called withdrawal bleeding, and is not considered a menstrual period.

A pill bleed is a withdrawal bleed from contraceptive drugs.
